    Build PC for running deep reinforcement learning tasks

    Assembling PC for deep reinforcement learning


    • Suwon, South Korea
    • Website
    • Email
    • Facebook

    To handle heavy tasks of deep reinforcement learning (DRL), a PC needs to have a strong configuration with GPU included. After referenced a lot of articles on the Internet (mainly from this), I finally choose a configuration, which can meet my requirements. This is information of the PC’s configuration:

    Hardware Name Description Price
    Motherboard X99E_WS Allow to add multiple GPUs 500$
    CPU Intell Core i7-5930K Not too much important (because we have GPU) 650$
    GPU NVIDIA GTX 1080 Defeat most of GPU except Titan series (expensive) 700$
    Ram 32GB DDR4 Nothing special. We can upgrade later 200$
    SSD 500 GB Samsung 850 EVO Fast enough to read/write IOs 200$
    PSU Leadex Gold 1000W Enough to supply electric to whole PC 250$
    CPU Cooler CNPS10X Optima Best for CPU Socket 2011v3 50$
    Case Stealth (A domestic brand in Korea) A good thing from this PC case is that it has a lot of fans 50$
    Total     2600$

    As an amateur, I must spend almost two days for assembling the PC and installing softwares (Ubuntu, Tensorflow and other stuffs).

    I end the setup by running a new DRL algorithm called DDPG in swing-up pendulum task. The code is written in Python and you can find them in here.

    Finally, the PC run well and I hoped that this PC will help me do more research tasks in deep reinforcement learning during PhD life :)

    Categories: Deep Reinforcement Learning, PC

    Updated: January 06, 2017
